alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson; Yuma (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued December 02 at 12:32PM MST until December 02 at 1:00PM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A DUST STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 100 PM MST FOR YUMA AND KIT CARSON COUNTIES... At 1231 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a cold front extending from 9 miles south of Haigler to 9 miles southwest of Bonny Reservoir to near Bethune to 5 miles south of Seibert, moving southeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Near zero visibility with damaging wind in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar, public reports and satellite images.. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 391 and 450. Highway 385 between mile markers 170 and 269. This dust channel will be near... Bethune around 1235 PM MST. This dust storm is impacting Interstate 70! Other locations impacted by this dust storm include Joes, Hale, Abarr, Beecher Island, Kirk, Heartstrong and Alvin. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... There is no safe place on a highway when a dust storm hits. Visibility can be lost immediately, making it difficult or impossible to slow down and avoid stopped vehicles. Delay travel, or safely exit the highway before the dust storm arrives.
